div.l: And whanne sche ganne this white thing aspie
Sche wente the Clerke had werid a voluper
And with the staff sche drow ay nere and nere
And wente had hitte this Aleyn at the fulle
And smote the Miller on the pelid skulle
That downe he goth and cride harowe I die
And And This Clerkis bete hym welle and lete hym lie
And greythengrethengreythen hem and toke hir hors a noon
And eke hir mele and on hir wey they gon
And atte the Mille dore they toke hir kake
Of half a buschell floure ful well I bake
Thus is the proude Miller welle I bete
And hath lost the grindyng of the whete
And paide for the soper eủerydelle
Of Aleyn and of Iohn that bete hym well
His wiff was dight and his doughtir als
Loo souche it is a Miller to be fals
And therfor this proủerbe is seide ful soth
Hym thare well wene that evill dothe
A gilour schal hym silf begilid be
God that sittith high in mageste
Saue all this cumpanye grete and smale
Thus haue I quite the Miller his tale
The Coke of London while the Reue spake
For ioy hym thought he clawid hym on his bakke
Ha ha qduod he for Cristis passion
The Miller hath a scharpe conclusion
Vpon his argument of herbigage
Welle saide Salamon in his language
Bringe nought eủery man to thyne hous
For herbering be nyght is ꝑperilous
Welle ought a man avisid for to be
